content: Keeps track of runs, but do not like layout, also if forget to turn off right after skiing at resort. It tracks you all the way home as another run. So that totally messes up yours days data. Used Trace before it figured out more things, jumps speed much better design too. Sorry I paid for this, other free ones are much better !
replyContent: You can cleanup the recorded tracks by deleting what you don't want. Layout is not working yet because of Android11 incompatibility. There is also a free SkiApp LITE available if you dont want to pay. Moreover SkiApp is respecting your privacy, not collecting or selling your personal data. Please check the SkiApp again after upcomming updates.

content: First day feedback: 1. Is there no way to filter out walks/stand stills? Or at least configure what counts as a stand still? Today there was almost no waiting but app recorded 18 of them, I imagine being with a group would make this worse. 2. The export function throws an error saying it couldn't create the folder (any format). No guidance in the app what could be wrong. 3. There should be a way to see the mountain or a map? In the overview screen there is a "map view" button that does nothing.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback. Questions 2 and 3 are issues due to new restrictions added with Android 10 and 11 which are blocking access of the App to storage. This is not fixed yet in the SkiApp. Question 1: If you stand for more than ~ 30 secons this will be counted as stand still in order not to spoil the average velocity. eriegel@mnet-online.de

content: It worked great for 3 years. In January this year it stopped working and just takes up space on my phone.
replyContent: This is probably related to an Android system update. Please make sure you are using the latest Version of the SkiApp to make sure it is handling all the added Restrictions of the newer Android System properly. Please make also sure your device is not set to a power saving mode in the energy settings and all requested permissions are permitted.

content: Perfect app!
Awesome app.

A great app!, I'm a rows and column guy and this app smartly collects the data and displays the stats intuitively. Has some edit and export functionality and a nice active GUI of each run with a histogram display of stats anywhere on the run. PLEAS PORT THIS APP TO Apple my kids got me an iphone and I miss your app
Amazing app, fantastic
Aewsome.
So how do I get rid of the tracks that came with this app
replyContent: Long-Tap on any track or stage opens a context menu. Among different options select "delete" to delete the track or stage. If you want delete all demo-data delete the three demo stages this way swiping to All-Stages before (very right).

content: Could not tell that it was not active on a previous outing. Silly me. Thought starting the app was all it would take. Had to find some hidden setting in the deep recesses. Otherwise seems pretty good. Have yet to try loading this info into a laptop for review on a bigger screen. Advise?
replyContent: To review the recordings on a computer best is to export to KMZ format and to open the data using Google Earth. Regarding the recording activation, under settings you can set a check to start recording immediately after you launch the app. Otherwise you have always to press the combined pause/record button to start recording. Enjoy the SkiApp!

content: Used for a year now...Great tracker Used all season. Works well, tracks skiing, lifts and walking while at the ski area. Appears very accurate, have compared it to epic mix. Results usually agree or are more accurate than epic mix. An option to announce time every 15 minutes or so would be a nice addition.
Works great, shows tracks accurately and neat to know speed and wait times.

Does everything I would want from a ski tracking app. Editing/clean-up of recorded data can be a bit counterintuitive, and it would be helpful to be able to split segments when, for example, a ski and part of a lift segment are interpreted as one activity. (This happens only occasionally.)
Excellent app, couldn't ski without it
brill üòÅ
Like the stats it keeps
good
easy to clean up accidental runs, like the drive home.
doesn'r run down battery too much. easy to use
Stable and reliable app. Very good detail.
Super reliable
nice app
Good app.
the more you look the better it gets

Terrible! I bought it as it worked nicely the first day. It worked for two more days. Then it just would not turn on as it kept "discovering" problems. Told me my battery was on safe mode, which is never the case. Then it suggested I should uncover the antenna. So it worked just fine for three days and then on the same slopes, in the same pocket, in the same jacket, the antenna was covered?! I was advised to put the phone on my chest uncovered. How about mounting it on my helmet!
replyContent:
Sorry for that experience. The App does not KNOW what is wrong, it is giving you advices what you COULD do to IMPROVE the functionality. Try this to solve the battery related isses: 
https://support.doubletwist.com/hc/en-us/articles/360001504071-How-to-turn-off-battery-optimization-on-Huawei-devices
Write to eriegel@mnet-online.de for assistance.

content: very good app,does everything I need and seems accurate.

I had high hopes for this app, but it just didn't track like I wanted it to. For example, in one day of skiing it tracked 150 events. If I stopped in the slope to wait for someone for even a brief amount of time, that was a new track. This meant that the number of runs was overstated. Overall disappointing
replyContent: The two slope runs you mentioned are separated by a hold track in the list of tracks. This happens if you stop for at least one minute! But in statistics view it displays this as 1 run  with the number of separate tracks in brackets behind. So all is accurate because you see your REAL slope and hold time AND the number of slope runs in statistics!

content: great, love to see what you did after a day of skiing.

The app is great and has all the features that I was looking for and more. I found it very accurate. To my embarrassment, I didn't figure out how to disable the auto power saving on my phone, that kept shutting down the app, but the developer offered me really quick support via email. Thank you very much for this great app and for the uniqie customer service you provide!

Was great in my Android 7.1 phone but won't work on new Moto x4 running Android 9 Pie. App no longer recognizes the GPS. keeps asking to turn in GPS but it is already on.. other apps are using the GPS fine unfortunately not SkiApp Pro. Hopefully it gets fixed soon.
replyContent: Sorry for that. Please double check that the SkiApp has all the required access rights to get the GPS signal. If this does not fix the issue, please send me a screenshot of SkiApps error message to eriegel@mnet-online.de. It is possible that this issue is device dependent as other Android 9 users are able to use SkiApp on their devices.

content: I spent a long time looking for a decent app to record my speed and distance when skiing. Out of all the ones I've tried, this one is the nuts.

I tried all of the ski trackers on the play store. This one is definately 
the best one around! With in depth statistics of every track and the 
ability to change, merge and delete tracks you have complete controll. If I 
could I would give 6 stars!
Simple and provide what I need
Easy, accurate and informative.

Great wee app, tells me everything I need to know... and more! In fact that's why its only 4 stars. Do wish I had an option to only show ski runs and chairlifts rather than any stops or walks along the way, just adds unnecessary clutter. Map could also do with some work, but other than that it's a really good app and I've relied on it a lot.
Brilliant app

Only second day of skiing with this app which is mostly pretty cool. The biggest issue is that it randomly pauses.  Perhaps a problem w/ my phone (OnePlus 5) but the bottom line is that is is not usable for me for a day on the mountain.
replyContent:
The issie is caused by an Android-Bug. Please disable energy saving settings for the SkiApp to fix it. Check following Site or contact me on eriegel@mnet-online.de. 

http://nine-faq.9folders.com/articles/8698-how-to-turn-off-battery-optimization-on-the-samsung-galaxy-android-6-7-and-8-devices

content: Astoundingly great app. You should be proud of your work.  Provides so much in depth data, top speeds, distance, time splits between lifts, walking, skiing etc.  This app adds another whole dimension to your day on the hill. Compete with friends, monitor personal bests, see what runs you might have missed. Doesn't even seem to use much battery.
Very good as is, but filtering out everything but downhill stuff from the track view most desperately needed!
best app to track your activities on the piste
Nice app. Gives skiing a different angle.

Nice app. But I would like to be able to remove all walk or stay tracks and combine all the downhill tracks into one, so that I can see clearly the ski lift and the ski run. Everybody stops during the descent and it does not look nice to have all the info at the same level. Or make the walking/stay tracks a lot smaller. Also, it would be nice to be able to name the downhill tracks and the ski lift and have the app recognize them on future runs (and displayed in the tracks view)
Easy to use but lose connection in certain mountain areas.
I'm just learning how to use the app and liking the detailed features provided in the reports.
Good job,Eugen!
Worked well last year. Doesn't record any of my runs any more despite being in full coverage.
replyContent: Sorry for that experience. This sounds very strange as since last season there were just bugfixes I have implemented. Please make sure you have toggled the combined PAUSE/RECORD button to activate tracking. Please take also a look onto the GPS accuracy information provided behind the satellite symbol. For direct assitance: eriegel@mnet-online.de.

content: Have been using the full app skiing in Val Thorens.  A really useful piece of kit to have. Allows you to check what you have done as well as speed, time etc.   Useful exports as well.   I'm certainly happy.
GPS functionality nonexistent. Basically a. Rick of an app.  Don't bother with pro edition.
replyContent: Sorry for that experience. Please make sure you have activated GPS recording in the APP using the combined record-pause button. Otherwise the tracking is disabled.

content: Great App... what would make it even better would be tracking your G Force!!
Great app
Nice app just missing the connectivity to art watch
Great way to track your runs for a day on the slopes. Just wish the GPS lock was better understanding that it is dependent on hardware and location and stuff.
The best and complete app I've found to track my days on ski. Really worth to buy it guys!
Excellent
Love this so far. One bit of suggestion. The ability to print out the map with all your runs. Screenshot does not do it justice.
Great app
Really Nice app to show show what you did on the slopes. Also makes a daily statistics. The map is cool too. Maybe a post this on .. function, too be added?
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback :) If you mean a "share" feature, its already there. You can share any track or stage in many ways (facebook, e-mail, threema, whatsapp). This is available inside the function menu behind the three-dots-button on top right, or via the context menu being opened on a long-tap  in the list of tracks or stages. Enjoy the SkiApp!

content: The best
Is a good app. I will send you a photo of how I see the share photo. PS : low the price in order to have more buyers. Also put the default 'immediate recording ' to false.

I really like the real time updates enough I purchased the pro version. So far the only thing I wish it had was a setting to allow it to start in the paused state instead of automatically start logging when the app is started.
replyContent: Hello, thank you for your rating. I will add a setting to start in paused state in the next version. Enjoy the SkiApp!
